section.p: You can install the cable management arm on either side of the server. You need both the slide rail box and the cable management arm box for this installation. You can choose the cable management arm assembly or the cable management arm assembly for large capacity, depending on your requirements. You do not need tools or cage nuts/clip nuts to install the server in a rack cabinet. When you install a 2U server, install the slide rails in the bottom U of the 2U area in the rack.
section.title: Back view of an appliance
section.p: The following diagram shows the components on the back panel of an appliance.

image.alt: Components on the back panel of an appliance.

section.p:
The labels in the diagram represent the following components on the back panel of an appliance:
A The high speed ports, eth6 and eth7. The 40GbE/10GbE interfaces on the appliance. The ports can be used with the Mellanox QSA adapter that is provided. These ports provide the highest throughput and lowest latency.
B The high availability (HA) ports, ha1 and ha0. If you are configuring the appliance for high availability, use the high speed networking cable that is provided. You must connect the cables between the same ports on each appliance. That is, ha0 on the primary appliance must be connected to ha0 on the standby appliance. The ha1 on the primary appliance must be connected to ha1 on the standby appliance.
C Hot-swap power supplies.
D Management ports, mgt0 and mgt1. The management ports are used to connect to the or to connect to the command-line remotely. An ethernet cable is required for the connection.
E 1 Gb Ethernet ports eth0 and eth1. You can connect an ethernet cable between these ports and the network that is used by the messaging clients.
F 1 Gb Ethernet ports, eth2, eth3, eth4, eth5. You can connect an ethernet cable between these ports and the network that is used by the messaging clients.
G Ethernet port for IBM Integrated Management Module II (IMM2). You can configure IBM Integrated Management Module II (IMM2) to monitor hardware status. For information about IMM, see the IBM Integrated Management Module II User's Guide.
H Video port. You can connect a monitor to this port by using a VGA cable. The maximum video resolution is 1600 x 1200 at 75 Hz.
I Serial port. Connect a 9-pin serial device to this connector. The serial port is shared with the IBM Integrated Management Module II (IMM2). The IMM2 can take control of the shared serial port to redirect serial traffic, by using Serial over LAN (SOL).
J 4 USB ports. You can connect a USB device, such as USB mouse, keyboard, or other USB device, to any of these connectors.
The appliance includes data storage, a system battery, fan modules, and power modules.

section.title: Points to consider when planning the installation of your appliance
section.p:
When you plan your installation, you might want to consider the following points:
Consider the size of the appliance. The appliance is 2U form factor. Therefore, consider the amount of rack space that you need and the number of people that are required to install the server.
Consider the number of sockets that you need. Two power sockets are required for each appliance.
Consider the number of power units that you need. You might need four power units for a full rack.
Consider cabling requirements. You must allow space for the cable arm. If you are configuring an HA pair of appliances, you must ensure that the appliances are close to one another so that the high speed networking cable that connects the appliances can be fitted. Cables must be bundled with hook-and-loop fastener strap for full movement of the cable management arm. Allow slack in all cables to avoid tension in the cables as the cable management arm moves. Power cords and other cables are attached to the rear of the appliance, including keyboard, monitor, and mouse cables if required.
Consider the design of your power and ethernet array.
Consider how you want to use the ports. There are 8 x 1 GbE copper ethernet ports available. You must use two ports for management traffic, for example web UI or SSH traffic. The other six ports can be used for data or messaging traffic. There are 4 x 40gb QSFP ports available. The ha0 and ha1 ports are dedicated for high availability. The other two ports (eth6 and eth7) are for data or messaging traffic. Ports eth6 and eth7 can be used with the Mellanox QSA adapter that is provided.
